value.title: The path to real-world artificial intelligence
value.excerpt: Experts from MIT and IBM held a webinar this week to discuss where AI technologies are today and advances that will help make their usage more practical and widespread.

value.title: White House advisory council calls on U.S. to increase AI funding to $10 billion by 2030
value.excerpt: PCAST, an advisory council within the U.S. Office of Science and Technology, recommends increasing government investment in AI research.

value.title: AI Weekly: Welcome to The Machine, VentureBeat’s AI site
value.excerpt: VentureBeat reorganized its site and branding to better faciliate the distinct communities it's cultivated around AI and gaming. Meet "The Machine."

value.title: Foxconn launches iAI Institute aimed to train people in industrial artificial intelligence
value.excerpt: Foxconn launched the iAI Institute “an initiative focused on training the workforce of tomorrow and sharing Industrial AI knowledge across industries.”  The iAI Institute plans to help train people in industrial artificial intelligence.

value.title: The best way for companies to incorporate ESG goals is by using data science and AI
value.excerpt: Junta Nakai, global industry leader for financial services at Databricks, explains why using tech is the key to truly realizing the benefits of ESG.

value.title: Facebook’s AI separates speech in recordings of up to 5 people
value.excerpt: Facebook researchers describe an AI system that can isolate speech from recordings of multiple speakers on a single microphone.

value.title: Tools for language access during COVID-19
value.excerpt: Translation services make it easier to communicate with someone who doesn’t speak the same language, whether you’re traveling abroad or living in a new country. value.title: Societal upheaval during the COVID-19 pandemic underscores need for new AI data regulations
value.excerpt: How should society address the scenario where the AI algorithm got it right but from an ethical standpoint, we're uncomfortable with the results?

value.title: Aryballe raises $7.9 million for odor-detecting AI sensors
value.excerpt: Aryballe, which develops AI-powered products capable of detecting and analyzing scents, has raised $7.9 million in venture capital.

value.title: AI 50 Founders Predict What Artificial Intelligence Will Look Like After Covid-19

value.title: Data privacy concerns weigh heavily on China’s AI leadership ambitions amid US trade sanctions
value.excerpt: Chinese organisations are expected to strike a delicate balancing act to advance artificial intelligence development, while ensuring the technology’s ethical application amid recent US trade sanctions.

value.title: Facebook A.I. could fix one of the most annoying problems in video chat apps
value.excerpt: Facebook has developed a new, cutting-edge artificial intelligence that’s able to distinguish up to five voices speaking simultaneously.

value.title: IISc research team designs eye gaze-controlled robotic arm for speech and motor impaired
value.excerpt: An Indian Institute of Science (IISc) research team has designed a robotic arm that can be manipulated by eye movement using a computer interface, to help people with Severe Speech and Motor Impairment (SSMI).

value.title: This Company Utilizes AI to Maximize Customer Acquisition
value.excerpt: To truly scale your business, you need to gather your own customer data and discover how to personalize it to acquire new customers and turn existing customers into lifetime ones. That's easier said than done.

value.title: How AI Could Revolutionize The Future Of Mobile
value.excerpt: There are a variety of ways in which AI will influence the way we design, program and use mobile apps. In the coming years, AI could lead to improved security, more personalization and overall a better user experience.

value.title: AI As A Service Redefines Customer Experiences, But Think Twice Before You Jump Into AutoML
value.excerpt: Keep reading, as this article will help you understand how humans and machines can work together to make machine learning more effective with augmented ML, and most importantly, cover a few key technical debt concerns you need to address prior to jumpstarting your own AutoML (AI for AI).

value.title: Tech News: Neuromorphic computing and the brain-on-a-chip in your pocket
value.excerpt: The human brain is relatively small, uses about 20 Watts of power and can accomplish an amazing number of complex tasks.

value.title: Chinese self-driving start-up WeRide to test fully driverless cars in Guangzhou
value.excerpt: WeRide’s permit for road tests of fully driverless cars on the open road takes it one step closer to the realisation of fully driverless mobility services.

value.title: ‘Artificial Intelligence will aid in better decision-making capacity’
value.excerpt: MUMBAI: Artificial intelligence (AI) will not only help to resolve complex global problems but can enable businesses make better decisions on a day-to-day basis if applied well, said panelists at the Mint Pivot or Perish webinar on automation in the new normal post covid pandemic.

value.title: A sushi restaurant chain in Japan is using AI to evaluate tuna cuts
value.excerpt: A Japanese advertising agency has created an app that uses AI to allow humans to easily grade the quality of a tuna cut.

value.title: AI wants to make your writing more polite
value.excerpt: Carnegie Mellon University scientists come up with a technique that automatically makes communication better mannered, thank you very much.

value.title: An update on our work on AI and responsible innovation

value.title: LOOK: In Covid-19 world, robots could be just what the doctor ordered
value.excerpt: The worldwide health crisis has added urgency to the question of how to bring robotics into the public health equation.
